results.title: The Care behind the smile
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Australia. Dept. of Health, Housing and Community Services, Suzanne Baker and Debby Kingsland
results.brief_description: Dental therapists are badly needed in schools to ensure bad tooth decay does not develop amongst children. The film tells of the Australia-wide dental therapist training scheme, which will provide dental therapists for schools.

results.title: The Cardioid
results.brief_description: Illustrates the properties of the cardioid which are connected with the generation as a one-cusped epicycloid. In five parts, it deals with he double generation of the cardioid, the tangents, the normals, the evolute, and a recapitulation of these aspects. Curves mechanically drawn by Jack Peskett.
results.description: Illustrates the properties of the cardioid which are connected with the generation as a one-cusped epicycloid. results.title: The Card
results.creator_credit: British Film-Makers Limited, John Bryan and Ronald Neame
results.brief_description: Edward Henry Machin (Alec Guinness), Denry for short, has been determined from youth to master his own fate. He uses his powers of persuasion and deception to cajole his way to fame and fortune, but still manages to remain friends with everyone. Affectionately known as ‘The Card’, Denry’s ultimate coup occurs when he becomes the youngest mayor of his home town of Bursley. Denry is not without female companionship, and his life is influenced by three women; a Countess, a dancing teacher, and the councillor’s daughter. It is through his relationship with these women that his deceptive ways are exposed. Also starring Glynis Johns, Valerie Hobson and Petula Clark. Based on the novel by Arnold Bennett and screenplay by Eric Ambler. Also known as “The Promoter”.

results.title: The Car man: Pininfarina
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Anthony de Lotbinière and Denis Postle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Pacemakers”.
Pininfarina, the world’s greatest name in automobile design, founder of a firm which builds 25,000 car bodies a year, and designs many others. Farina has used his uncanny feeling for the look and shape of cars to build a unique industry - an industry which is ideally suited to a comparatively small industrial nation like Italy, and which has given her a reputation unequalled in the world. Commentary written and spoken by Anthony Jay.

results.brief_description: Summary: three alternative materials to steel for car bodies are highlighted. fully functional cars which have been made in glass reinforced plastic, wood and plastic are shown and their designers justify the use of these materials. there is a discussion

results.title: The Car behind
results.creator_credit: Telemark Productions, Film Australia and Commonwealth Department of Transport
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Advises on the precautions to be taken when driving in front of another vehicle, including procedures for overtaking, increasing the distance between cars, and the use of brake lights, traffic indicators, and hand signals. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Telemark Productions, Film Australia and Commonwealth Department of Transport

results.title: The Car and the city
results.creator_credit: United Nations Films and Boris Holtzman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
The automobile is a serious polluter of the air and a major interruption to urban activities. So planners are looking at ways to change or limit the use of the conventional automobile in large cities, and to ease mass transit flow. Features William Lear’s 1975 steam car, a representative of the US EPA and John Esposito from the Ralph Nader Center for Study of Responsive Law, and Helen Leavitt, author of “Super-highway, super hoax”.

results.title: The Car ahead
results.creator_credit: Telemark Productions, Film Australia and Commonwealth Department of Transport
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Demonstrates the reaction time between a signal to brake and the application of the brake by the driver. Advises on precautions to be taken when following another vehicle. Suitable for upper secondary level.
